greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: First factor in happy factorization of n-th rectangular number.
comment: notation: B in the Conway link.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..200
J. H. Conway, On Happy Factorizations, J. Integer Sequences, Vol. 1, 1998, #1.
mathematica: r[b_, c_] := (red = Reduce[x>0 && y>0 && b*x^2 + 1 == c*y^2, {x, y}, Integers] /. C[1] -> 1 // Simplify; If[Head[red] === Or, First[red], red]); f[128] = {}(* to speed up *); f[n_] := f[n] = If[IntegerQ[Sqrt[n]], {}, Do[c = n/b; If[(r0 = r[b, c]) =!= False, {x0, y0} = {x, y} /. ToRules[r0]; Return[{b, c, x0, y0}]], {b, Divisors[n] // Most}]]; A191854 = Reap[Table[Print[n, " ", f[n]]; If[f[n] != {} && f[n] =!= Null, Sow[f[n][[1]]]], {n, 1, 130}]][[2, 1]] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 18 2015 *)
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jun 18 2011
ext: Wrong formula removed (thanks to _Wolfdieter Lang_, who pointed this out) by _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 11 2015
